CDL|02509-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 0900652-004: ECHO CHALET INC / H WELL 02/100 M OF TANK
CDL|02509-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02509-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02509-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02509-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02509-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02514-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 3610011-003: CEDARPINES PARK MWC / COON TURN 05-VERTICAL
CDL|02514-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02514-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02514-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02514-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02514-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02518-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02518-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02518-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02518-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02518-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02527-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 3610044-045: DWP - BIG BEAR LAKE/MOONRIDGE / SLANT WELL 19 (HORIZONTAL)
CDL|02527-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02527-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02527-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02527-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02527-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02532-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. CDL|02536-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02536-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02536-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02536-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02536-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02540-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 2700738-002: SAN MIGUEL WS #01 / WELL 02
CDL|02540-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02540-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02540-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02540-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02540-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02545-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 5500053-003: LEISURE PINES MUTUAL WATER CO / WELL 3
CDL|02545-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02545-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02545-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02545-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02545-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02549-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 3410001-006: SACRAMENTO SUBURBAN WATER DISTRICT / WELL 08 - SOUTH PARK/WRENDALE-ABAND
CDL|02549-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02549-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02549-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02549-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02549-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02553-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02553-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02562-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 3710012-020: RANCHO PAUMA MUTUAL WC / WELL V/O
CDL|02562-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02562-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02562-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02562-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02562-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02566-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 4110010-008: MONTARA WATER AND SANITARY DISTRICT / PORTOLA WELL 01
CDL|02566-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02566-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02566-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02566-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02566-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02575-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubdate|20110114
CDL|02575-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 3610024-015: HESPERIA WD / WELL 20
CDL|02575-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02575-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02575-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02575-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02575-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02579-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02579-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02579-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02583-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02583-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02592-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA

CDL|02592-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02592-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02596-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02596-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02605-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 5000481-002: FOSTER FARMS-ELLENWOOD HATCHERY / OLD WELL (WESTERN BY PLANT)
CDL|02605-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02605-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02605-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02605-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02605-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02609-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 4901004-001: CALPINE (WEST FIELD OFFICE) / GDC 66-12 SPRING
CDL|02609-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02609-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02609-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02609-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02609-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02613-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 1500571-002: LUCKY 18 ON ROSAMOND, LLC / WELL 02 - WEST
CDL|02613-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02613-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02613-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02613-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02613-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02617-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02617-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02617-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02622-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 2100576-001: PIAZZI BUILDING / WELL 01
CDL|02622-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02622-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02622-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02622-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02622-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02626-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 0610002-005: CITY OF COLUSA / WELL 05 - 3RD & LARSEN
CDL|02626-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02626-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02626-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02626-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02626-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02630-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 2702368-002: PRUNETREE SHOPPING CENTER WS / WELL 02
CDL|02630-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02630-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02630-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02630-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02630-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02634-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 1300575-001: DATE GARDENS MOBILE HOME PARK / DATE GARDENS MOBILE HOME PARK
CDL|02634-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02634-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02634-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02634-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02634-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02643-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 0706059-001: GAS N SAVE / WELL HEAD
CDL|02643-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02643-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02643-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02643-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02643-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02647-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 1010007-201: FRESNO, CITY OF / WELL 067 - RAW
CDL|02647-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02647-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02647-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02647-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02647-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02651-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02651-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02655-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 5402048-002: DEL ORO RIVER ISLAND SERV TERR #2 / WELL 02
CDL|02655-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02655-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02655-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02655-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02655-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02659-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02659-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02664-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 4310006-015: CITY OF MORGAN HILL / DUNNE WELL 02
CDL|02664-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02664-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02664-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02664-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02664-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02668-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 2000524-002: SKY ACRES MUTUAL WATER CORP / SOURCE WELL 5 (WELL 2)
CDL|02668-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02668-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02668-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02668-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02668-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02672-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 2300736-001: CASPAR BEACH RV PARK / WELL 01
CDL|02672-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02672-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02672-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02672-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02672-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02676-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 1010018-010: KERMAN, CITY OF / WELL 09 - DESTROYED 2004
CDL|02676-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02676-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02676-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02676-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02676-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02680-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 1510038-023: BEAR VALLEY CSD F / WELL 23 - INACTIVE
CDL|02680-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02680-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02680-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02680-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02680-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02685-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 1510020-004: TEHACHAPI, CITY OF / PINON WELL
CDL|02685-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02685-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02685-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02685-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02685-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02689-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 1000299-002: THREE PALMS MOBILEHOME PARK / WELL 02 - STANDBY
CDL|02689-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02689-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02689-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02689-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02689-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02694-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 2000529-002: BONADELLE RANCHOS MUTUAL WATER / SOURCE 1999 WELL 2
CDL|02694-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02694-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02694-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02694-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02694-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02698-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 3610014-021: CITY OF COLTON / WELL 24
CDL|02698-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02698-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02698-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02698-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02698-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02702-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 2600614-001: JUNE MTN. SKI AREA, STEW POT SLIM S / WELL
CDL|02702-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02702-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02702-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02702-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02702-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02706-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 3610063-006: GOLDEN STATE WATER CO - MORONGO DEL SUR / YEAGER NO 2
CDL|02706-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02706-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02706-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02706-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02706-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02715-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 3702349-001: RANCHO L ABRI / WELL 01
CDL|02715-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02715-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02715-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02715-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02715-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02719-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 1510003-039: CWS - BAKERSFIELD / WELL 064-01 - RAW - INACTIVE
CDL|02719-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02719-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02719-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02719-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02719-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02728-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 3700035-001: OAK GROVE COMPLEX / WELL 01
CDL|02728-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02728-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02728-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02728-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02728-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02732-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 3000825-002: SOUTH MIDWAY CITY MUTUAL WATER CO. / NORTH WELL
CDL|02732-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02732-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02732-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02732-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02732-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02741-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 3600200-001: RANCHERITOS MWC / WELL 01
CDL|02741-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02741-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02741-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02741-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02741-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02745-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 2400059-001: CASA MIA APARTMENTS / SYSTEM WELL- N.W. CORNER OF PROPERTY
CDL|02745-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02745-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02745-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02745-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02745-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02749-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 4210006-013: LOMPOC-CITY WATER UTILITY DIV / WELL 09
CDL|02749-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02749-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02749-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02749-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02749-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02753-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/title|DWSAP Assessment for 4210013-006: SOLVANG WATER DEPARTMENT / WELL 21 - INACTIVE
CDL|02753-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/pubplace|Sacramento, CA
CDL|02753-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02753-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02753-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02753-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.

CDL|02757-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/pubinfo/publish|California Department of Public Health
CDL|02757-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/citation/citeinfo/onlink|http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/Pages/DWSAP.aspx
CDL|02757-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/abstract|A source water assessment identifies the vulnerability of the drinking water supply to contamination from typical human activities. The assessments are intended to facilitate and provide the basic information necessary for a local community to develop a program to protect the drinking water supply.
CDL|02757-metadata.xml|/metadata/idinfo/descript/purpose|An assessment includes a delineation of an area around a drinking water source through which contaminants might move and reach that drinking water supply. Included is an inventory list of activities that might lead to the release of microbiological or chemical contaminants within the delineated area. The California Drinking Water Source Assessment and Protection (DWSAP) Program document, (http://www.cdph.ca.gov/certlic/drinkingwater/documents/DWSAPGuidance/DWSAP_document.pdf) describes procedures for conducting drinking water source assessments. It conveys the goals and objectives that CDPH seeks to accomplish with the DWSAP program, along with methods that are technically appropriate and easily understood.
